parameters.name: url

get.description: Queries entities under the given table.

parameters.description: DataServiceVersion header

parameters.name: x-ms-version
parameters.description: The API version.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: The name of the table.

parameters.name: $format
parameters.description: Specifies the metadata format for the response.

values.name: MinimalMetadata
values.description: Minimal metadata. This is the default and the minimum required for full deserialization.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select expression using OData notation. Limits the columns on each record to just those requested.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter expression.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds.

parameters.name: NextPartitionKey
parameters.description: An entity partition key query continuation token from a previous call.

parameters.name: NextRowKey
parameters.description: An entity row key query continuation token from a previous call.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description:
Even though the response is 204, if we don't add explicit json, we will
get XML formatted error responses from the server.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Match condition for an entity to be deleted. If specified and a matching entity
is not found, an error will be raised. To force an unconditional delete, set to
the wildcard character (*).

parameters.description: The partition key of the entity.

parameters.name: rowKey
parameters.description: The row key of the entity.

parameters.description: The properties for the table entity.

get.description:
Retrieves statistics related to replication for the Table service. It is only
available on the secondary location endpoint when read-access geo-redundant
replication is enabled for the account.

parameters.name: x-ms-version
parameters.description: The API version.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds.

Date.description: UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated

x-ms-client-request-id.description: An opaque, globally-unique, client-generated string identifier for the request.

x-ms-request-id.description: An opaque, globally-unique, server-generated string identifier for the request.

start.description: The date-time the policy is active.

permission.description: The permissions for acl the policy.

CorsRule.description: CORS is an HTTP feature that enables a web application running under one domain to access resources in another domain. Web browsers implement a security restriction known as same-origin policy that prevents a web page from calling APIs in a different domain; CORS provides a secure way to allow one domain (the origin domain) to call APIs in another domain

allowedOrigins.description:
The origin domains that are permitted to make a request against the service via
CORS. The origin domain is the domain from which the request originates. Note
that the origin must be an exact case-sensitive match with the origin that the
user age sends to the service. You can also use the wildcard character '*' to
allow all origin domains to make requests via CORS.

allowedMethods.description:
The methods (HTTP request verbs) that the origin domain may use for a CORS
request.

allowedHeaders.description: The request headers that the origin domain may specify on the CORS request.

exposedHeaders.description:
The response headers that may be sent in the response to the CORS request and
exposed by the browser to the request issuer.

maxAgeInSeconds.description:
The maximum amount time that a browser should cache the preflight OPTIONS
request.

CreateTableEchoResponse.description: Create table successful response with content

CreateTableResponse.description: Create table response with no content

GeoReplication.description: Geo-Replication information for the Secondary Storage Service

status.description: The status of the secondary location

lastSyncTime.description: A GMT date/time value, to the second. All primary writes preceding this value are guaranteed to be available for read operations at the secondary. Primary writes after this point in time may or may not be available for reads.

GeoReplicationStatusType.description: The status of the secondary location.

InsertEntityEchoResponse.description: Insert entity successful response with content

InsertEntityResponse.description: Insert entity response with no content

version.description: The version of the logging properties.

retentionPolicy.description: The retention policy of the logs.

version.description: The version of the metrics properties.

enabled.description: Indicates whether metrics are enabled for the Table service.

includeApis.description:
Indicates whether metrics should generate summary statistics for called API
operations.

retentionPolicy.description: The retention policy of the metrics.

OdataMetadataFormat.description: Specifies the level of metadata to be returned with the response.

values.name: MinimalMetadata
values.description: Minimal metadata. This is the default and the minimum required for full deserialization.

ResponseFormat.description: Specifies whether the response should echo the created content.

values.name: ReturnNoContent
values.description: Do not echo the created content.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the retention policy.

days.description:
Indicates the number of days that metrics or logging or soft-deleted data
should be retained. All data older than this value will be deleted.

id.description: The unique ID for the signed identifier.

accessPolicy.description: The access policy for the signed identifier.
